name: Bear Walk
how_to_perform:
1. Start on all fours, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees directly under your hips.
2. Take a large step forward with one hand and both legs, in a bear-like movement. This will stretch the opposite arm and keep it active throughout the exercise.
3. Keep your weight low over your forearms, with your arms still on the ground for support if needed.
4. Continue walking by stepping forward with one hand and leg combination at a time, alternating hands and legs with each step.
5. Engage your core and keep your back straight by squeezing your abdominal muscles as you bear walk.
6. Keep your movement slow and controlled to target the lower body
short_summary: Bear Walk is a dynamic exercise that targets multiple muscle groups in the lower body.
